alert.note: Alert for Coleman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 4:46PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Coleman County through 530 PM CDT... At 446 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Leaday, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coleman, Voss, Gouldbusk, Leaday, Rockwood, Mozelle, Whon, Fisk and Shields. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
